channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Parallels Access Brings Windows and Mac Apps to Android
item.description:
Android: Mobile OSes are great, but they're still a bit limited in what they can do compared to desktops. Parallels Access, previously available for iOS , allows you to run your Windows and Mac apps on Android.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Deals: Nest Protect $99, Oscillating Tool Set, Polarized Sunglasses
item.description:
After a brief recall, the Nest Protect CO2 and smoke detector is once again available for sale, this time at a $30 discount. It's still more than your garden variety smoke detector, but boy is it awesome . [Nest Protect, $99]

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: Should I Come Out at Work?
item.description:
Dear Lifehacker,
I'm applying for jobs and I'm not sure if and when I should disclose to my potential employer that I'm gay. I don't want to work at a place that won't accept who I am, but I also need the money to pay bills. What should I do?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Figure Out What Compliments Your Boss Prefers to Suck Up Better
item.description:
It's important to get on the good side of your boss. There's nothing wrong with sucking up a little bit, but you need to figure out what kind of compliments they prefer—or it's going to be really obvious.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: ​Sunrise Adds Built-in Apps to Power Up Your Calendar
item.description:
iOS/Android: Sunrise, one of our favorite calendar apps , just added support for other apps like Songkick, Evernote, TripIt, and more.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Steam vs. Everyone Else: Who Really Has the Best Gaming Deals?
item.description:
It's summer, and that means a Steam sale is just around the corner. But does Steam really deserve its reputation for amazing deals? Well, yes—but there are a lot of other stores that don't get credit for being just as good. Here's a look and see how often the competition matches up to Steam's prices.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: ​Sign Into Multiple Dropbox Accounts on Android With ES File Explorer
item.description:
Dropbox is a great tool, but the official app only allows you to sign into one account at a time. If you need to work with multiple accounts, ES File Explorer, our favorite file explorer for Android , makes things easy.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Ginger Page Translates For You, Makes Sure Your English is Impeccable
item.description:
Android/iOS/Windows/Chrome: Whether you're learning English or you've been speaking it your whole life, Ginger Page is a new writing tool that wants to make sure that your spelling and grammar are accurate at home and on the go. The app translates other languages for you, offers contextual corrections, and more.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Gawker University of Washington Student Who Idolized Elliot Rodger Arrested | Jalopnik Watch A Dashc
item.description:
Gawker University of Washington Student Who Idolized Elliot Rodger Arrested | Jalopnik Watch A Dashcam Foil An Insurance Scam | Jezebel Humans Impersonate Dogs Barking, Dogs Lose All Of Their Shit | Kotaku Chinese Students Delight the Internet with Graduation Photos

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on io9, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Notation Is a Shortcut-Packed Syncing Note-Taking App for Windows
item.description:
Windows: If you want a simple note-taking app for Windows, you have plenty of options , but if you've used Notational Velocity on the Mac and miss its shortcuts and minimal design, Notation is here to help. It's fast, free, feature-packed, and syncs via SimpleNote.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Fauxbar Brings Firefox's "Awesome Bar" to Chrome
item.description:
Chrome: Firefox and Chrome both have their ups and downs . If you prefer the way Firefox's address bar works, Fauxbar brings that functionality to Chrome.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: "You Teach People How to Treat You"
item.description:
If you aren't happy with the way others treat you, it may have something to do with you. Motivational speaker Tony Gaskins says "You teach people how to treat you by what you allow, what you stop, and what you reinforce."

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Google Adds Step-By-Step Instructions to Search Results
item.description:
Google got a little smarter once again this week. Now, if you search for something that Google knows has a step-by-step answer, it will give those steps to you above the search results.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: The Best Things You Can Do at Costco Without a Membership
item.description:
For those willing to pay the membership fee, Costco is a great place to buy in bulk and access a number of services. However, If you don't want to pony up the cash, Wise Bread suggests plenty of things you can take advantage of without a card.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: The Disney Animator's Daily Bag
item.description:
Working for Disney's no joke. As John Edgar Park shows us, when you're in the CG animation department at DisneyToon Studios, you need to be prepared for all kinds of things.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Use Wooden Chopsticks for More Control When Frying Food
item.description:
When you think chopsticks, you probably think of asian cuisine, but they're great tools for different styles of frying a wide variety foods. Karen Ahn at WonderHowTo explains why they're perfect for dealing with hot oil.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Jalopnik The Painful Truth About NASA's Warp Drive Spaceship From A Physicist| Kotaku The Real Probl
item.description:
Jalopnik The Painful Truth About NASA's Warp Drive Spaceship From A Physicist| Kotaku The Real Problem With Sex Workers In Video Games | Gawker Hundreds of New Emoji Coming to Replace More Words | Jezebel Everything Wrong With New York Magazine's Terry Richardson Cover Story | Kinja Popular Posts

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on io9, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Master the Art of Reading with Lewis Carroll’s Four Rules of Learning
item.description:
Everyone knows Lewis Carroll as the author of Alice in Wonderland, but he was also a mathematician and logician interested in the ways people learn. Weblog Brain Pickings took a look at four rules developed by Carroll that you can use for better reading.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Replace the Glass on Your Broken iPad at Home
item.description:
A busted screen on your iPad can cost a pretty penny to get fixed, but you can do it at home if you're up to the challenge. Macworld spoke with Rory Pierce, a certified Apple technician, about the steps you should take when replacing the glass.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Flexiglass Controls Windows with Gestures and Keyboard Shortcuts
item.description:
Mac: OS X doesn't have much in the way of window management built into it, so if you're looking to control window placement and size with your keyboard or trackpad, you'll have to look elsewhere. Flexiglass is an app that does just that.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Why We Brag About Being Busy (And How to Regain Focus)
item.description:
We have a problem—and the odd thing is we not only know about it, we're celebrating it. Just today, someone boasted to me that she was so busy she's averaged four hours of sleep a night for the last two weeks. She wasn't complaining; she was proud of the fact. She is not alone.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Greg McKeown

item.title: Leave Out "But" Sentences During Difficult Conversations
item.description:
By their nature, difficult conversations are tough. If you want to avoid making them even harder, Psychology Today suggests staying away from sentences with "but" in them.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: All Seeing Eye Records Your Browsing History and Makes it Searchable
item.description:
Chrome: By default, Chrome records everywhere you go in its history, but that's about it. All Seeing Eye is an extension that also records all the text within the sites you visit, and grabs screenshots so you can easily find pages you've been to in the past.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Zero Out Your Accounts Every Month to Enforce a Zero-Sum Budget
item.description:
A zero-sum budget is an excellent way to reduce your spending and save more. Personal finance blog Money Crashers suggests taking this to the next level by emptying your main accounts every month.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Ask an Expert: All About Running and Marathon Training
item.description:
Say hello to Jason Fitzgerald, our expert running coach and marathon runner who's been helping people stay injury free while running and exercising for over 15 years.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Andy Orin
